intro: Boechera villosa, commonly known as the hairy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lobed leaves and small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera villosa typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for rocky garden settings.
